member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CopyDBClusterSnapshotRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CopyDBClusterSnapshot operation. Copies a snapshot of a cluster.
To copy a cluster snapshot from a shared manual cluster snapshot, SourceDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier must be the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the shared cluster snapshot. You can only copy a shared DB cluster snapshot, whether encrypted or not, in the same Region.
To cancel the copy operation after it is in progress, delete the target cluster snapshot identified by TargetDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier while that cluster snapshot is in the copying status.

summary.para: The SourceRegion for generating the PreSignedUrl property. If SourceRegion is set and the PreSignedUrl property is not, then PreSignedUrl will be automatically generated by the client.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CopyDBClusterSnapshotRequest.CopyTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CopyTags.
Set to true to copy all tags from the source cluster snapshot to the target cluster snapshot, and otherwise false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CopyDBClusterSnapshotRequest.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
The KMS key ID for an encrypted cluster snapshot. The KMS key ID is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN), KMS key identifier, or the KMS key alias for the KMS encryption key.
If you copy an encrypted cluster snapshot from your account, you can specify a value for KmsKeyId to encrypt the copy with a new KMS encryption key. If you don't specify a value for KmsKeyId, then the copy of the cluster snapshot is encrypted with the same KMS key as the source cluster snapshot.
If you copy an encrypted cluster snapshot that is shared from another account, then you must specify a value for KmsKeyId.
To copy an encrypted cluster snapshot to another Region, set KmsKeyId to the KMS key ID that you want to use to encrypt the copy of the cluster snapshot in the destination Region. KMS encryption keys are specific to the Region that they are created in, and you can't use encryption keys from one Region in another Region.
If you copy an unencrypted cluster snapshot and specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, an error is returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CopyDBClusterSnapshotRequest.PreSignedUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreSignedUrl.
The URL that contains a Signature Version 4 signed request for theCopyDBClusterSnapshot API action in the Region that contains the source cluster snapshot to copy. You must use the PreSignedUrl parameter when copying a cluster snapshot from another Region.
If you are using an Amazon Web Services SDK tool or the CLI, you can specify SourceRegion (or --source-region for the CLI) instead of specifying PreSignedUrl manually. Specifying SourceRegion autogenerates a pre-signed URL that is a valid request for the operation that can be executed in the source Region.
The presigned URL must be a valid request for the CopyDBClusterSnapshot API action that can be executed in the source Region that contains the cluster snapshot to be copied. The presigned URL request must contain the following parameter values:
SourceRegion - The ID of the region that contains the snapshot to be copied.
SourceDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier - The identifier for the the encrypted cluster snapshot to be copied. This identifier must be in the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) format for the source Region. For example, if you are copying an encrypted cluster snapshot from the us-east-1 Region, then your SourceDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier looks something like the following: arn:aws:rds:us-east-1:12345678012:sample-cluster:sample-cluster-snapshot.
TargetDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier - The identifier for the new cluster snapshot to be created. This parameter isn't case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CopyDBClusterSnapshotRequest.SourceDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier.
The identifier of the cluster snapshot to copy. This parameter is not case sensitive.
Constraints:
Must specify a valid system snapshot in the available state.
If the source snapshot is in the same Region as the copy, specify a valid snapshot identifier.
If the source snapshot is in a different Region than the copy, specify a valid cluster snapshot ARN.
Example: my-cluster-snapshot1

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CopyDBClusterSnapshotRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags to be assigned to the cluster snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CopyDBClusterSnapshotRequest.TargetDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier.
The identifier of the new cluster snapshot to create from the source cluster snapshot. This parameter is not case sensitive.
Constraints:
Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.
The first character must be a letter.
Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
Example: my-cluster-snapshot2

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateDBCluster operation. Creates a new Amazon DocumentDB cluster.

summary.para: The SourceRegion for generating the PreSignedUrl property. If SourceRegion is set and the PreSignedUrl property is not, then PreSignedUrl will be automatically generated by the client.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.AvailabilityZones
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZones.
A list of Amazon EC2 Availability Zones that instances in the cluster can be created in.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.BackupRetentionPeriod
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupRetentionPeriod.
The number of days for which automated backups are retained. You must specify a minimum value of 1.
Default: 1
Constraints:
Must be a value from 1 to 35.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.DBClusterIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterIdentifier.
The cluster identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
Constraints:
Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.
The first character must be a letter.
Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
Example: my-cluster

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.DBClusterParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterParameterGroupName.
The name of the cluster parameter group to associate with this cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.DBSubnetGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBSubnetGroupName.
A subnet group to associate with this cluster.
Constraints: Must match the name of an existing DBSubnetGroup. Must not be default.
Example: mySubnetgroup

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.DeletionProtection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeletionProtection.
Specifies whether this cluster can be deleted. If DeletionProtection is enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted unless it is modified and DeletionProtection is disabled. DeletionProtection protects clusters from being accidentally deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.EnableCloudwatchLogsExports
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnableCloudwatchLogsExports.
A list of log types that need to be enabled for exporting to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. You can enable audit logs or profiler logs. For more information, see Auditing Amazon DocumentDB Events and Profiling Amazon DocumentDB Operations.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.Engine
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Engine.
The name of the database engine to be used for this cluster.
Valid values: docdb

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.EngineVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngineVersion.
The version number of the database engine to use. The --engine-version will default to the latest major engine version. For production workloads, we recommend explicitly declaring this parameter with the intended major engine version.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.GlobalClusterIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GlobalClusterIdentifier.
The cluster identifier of the new global cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
The KMS key identifier for an encrypted cluster.
The KMS key identifier is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the KMS encryption key. If you are creating a cluster using the same account that owns the KMS encryption key that is used to encrypt the new cluster, you can use the KMS key alias instead of the ARN for the KMS encryption key.
If an encryption key is not specified in KmsKeyId:
If the StorageEncrypted parameter is true, Amazon DocumentDB uses your default encryption key.
KMS creates the default encryption key for your account. Your account has a different default encryption key for each Regions.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.MasterUsername
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MasterUsername.
The name of the master user for the cluster.
Constraints:
Must be from 1 to 63 letters or numbers.
The first character must be a letter.
Cannot be a reserved word for the chosen database engine.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.MasterUserPassword
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MasterUserPassword.
The password for the master database user. This password can contain any printable ASCII character except forward slash (/), double quote ("), or the "at" symbol (@).
Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 100 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
The port number on which the instances in the cluster accept connections.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.PreferredBackupWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreferredBackupWindow.
The daily time range during which automated backups are created if automated backups are enabled using the BackupRetentionPeriod parameter.
The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour block of time for each Region.
Constraints:
Must be in the format hh24:mi-hh24:mi.
Must be in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
Must not conflict with the preferred maintenance window.
Must be at least 30 minutes.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.PreferredMaintenanceWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreferredMaintenanceWindow.
The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi
The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour block of time for each Region, occurring on a random day of the week.
Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
Constraints: Minimum 30-minute window.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.PreSignedUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreSignedUrl.
Not currently supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.StorageEncrypted
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageEncrypted.
Specifies whether the cluster is encrypted.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags to be assigned to the cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterRequest.VpcSecurityGroupIds
member.summary:

A list of EC2 VPC security groups to associate with this cluster.

undo-opt-in - Cancel any existing next-maintenance opt-in requests.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration
member.summary:
The configuration setting for the log types to be enabled for export to Amazon CloudWatch Logs for a specific instance or cluster.
The EnableLogTypes and DisableLogTypes arrays determine which logs are exported (or not exported) to CloudWatch Logs. The values within these arrays depend on the engine that is being used.

Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterParameterGroupRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateDBClusterParameterGroup operation. Creates a new cluster parameter group.
Parameters in a cluster parameter group apply to all of the instances in a cluster.
A cluster parameter group is initially created with the default parameters for the database engine used by instances in the cluster. In Amazon DocumentDB, you cannot make modifications directly to the default.docdb3.6 cluster parameter group. If your Amazon DocumentDB cluster is using the default cluster parameter group and you want to modify a value in it, you must first create a new parameter group or copy an existing parameter group, modify it, and then apply the modified parameter group to your cluster. For the new cluster parameter group and associated settings to take effect, you must then reboot the instances in the cluster without failover. For more information, see Modifying Amazon DocumentDB Cluster Parameter Groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBClusterParameterGroupRequest.DBClusterParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterParameterGroupName.
The name of the cluster parameter group.
Constraints:

This value is stored as a lowercase string.

The cluster parameter group family name.

member.summary:

Default: A random, system-chosen Availability Zone in the endpoint's Region.
Example: us-east-1d

member.summary:

The compute and memory capacity of the instance; for example, db.r5.large.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBInstanceRequest.DBInstanceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBInstanceIdentifier.
The instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
Constraints:
Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.
The first character must be a letter.
Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
Example: mydbinstance

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBInstanceRequest.Engine
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Engine.
The name of the database engine to be used for this instance.
Valid value: docdb

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBInstanceRequest.PreferredMaintenanceWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreferredMaintenanceWindow.
The time range each week during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi
The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour block of time for each Region, occurring on a random day of the week.
Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
Constraints: Minimum 30-minute window.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateDBInstanceRequest.PromotionTier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PromotionTier.
A value that specifies the order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing primary instance.
Default: 1
Valid values: 0-15

The tags to be assigned to the instance. You can assign up to 10 tags to an instance.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateEventSubscriptionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateEventSubscription operation. Creates an Amazon DocumentDB event notification subscription. This action requires a topic Amazon Resource Name (ARN) created by using the Amazon DocumentDB console, the Amazon SNS console, or the Amazon SNS API. To obtain an ARN with Amazon SNS, you must create a topic in Amazon SNS and subscribe to the topic. The ARN is displayed in the Amazon SNS console.
You can specify the type of source (SourceType) that you want to be notified of. You can also provide a list of Amazon DocumentDB sources (SourceIds) that trigger the events, and you can provide a list of event categories (EventCategories) for events that you want to be notified of. For example, you can specify SourceType = db-instance, SourceIds = mydbinstance1, mydbinstance2 and EventCategories = Availability, Backup.
If you specify both the SourceType and SourceIds (such as SourceType = db-instance and SourceIdentifier = myDBInstance1), you are notified of all the db-instance events for the specified source. If you specify a SourceType but do not specify a SourceIdentifier, you receive notice of the events for that source type for all your Amazon DocumentDB sources. If you do not specify either the SourceType or the SourceIdentifier, you are notified of events generated from all Amazon DocumentDB sources belonging to your customer account.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateEventSubscriptionRequest.Enabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Enabled.
A Boolean value; set to true to activate the subscription, set to false to create the subscription but not active it.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateEventSubscriptionRequest.EventCategories
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventCategories.
A list of event categories for a SourceType that you want to subscribe to.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateEventSubscriptionRequest.SnsTopicArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnsTopicArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic created for event notification. Amazon SNS creates the ARN when you create a topic and subscribe to it.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateEventSubscriptionRequest.SourceIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceIds.
The list of identifiers of the event sources for which events are returned. If not specified, then all sources are included in the response. An identifier must begin with a letter and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens; it can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
Constraints:
If SourceIds are provided, SourceType must also be provided.
If the source type is an instance, a DBInstanceIdentifier must be provided.
If the source type is a security group, a DBSecurityGroupName must be provided.
If the source type is a parameter group, a DBParameterGroupName must be provided.
If the source type is a snapshot, a DBSnapshotIdentifier must be provided.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateEventSubscriptionRequest.SourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceType.
The type of source that is generating the events. For example, if you want to be notified of events generated by an instance, you would set this parameter to db-instance. If this value is not specified, all events are returned.
Valid values: db-instance, db-cluster, db-parameter-group, db-security-group, db-cluster-snapshot

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateEventSubscriptionRequest.SubscriptionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubscriptionName.
The name of the subscription.
Constraints: The name must be fewer than 255 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateEventSubscriptionRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags to be assigned to the event subscription.

member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateEventSubscription operation.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property EventSubscription.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateGlobalClusterRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateGlobalCluster operation. Creates an Amazon DocumentDB global cluster that can span multiple multiple Regions. The global cluster contains one primary cluster with read-write capability, and up-to give read-only secondary clusters. Global clusters uses storage-based fast replication across regions with latencies less than one second, using dedicated infrastructure with no impact to your workloads performance.
You can create a global cluster that is initially empty, and then add a primary and a secondary to it. Or you can specify an existing cluster during the create operation, and this cluster becomes the primary of the global cluster.
This action only applies to Amazon DocumentDB clusters.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateGlobalClusterRequest.DatabaseName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DatabaseName.
The name for your database of up to 64 alpha-numeric characters. If you do not provide a name, Amazon DocumentDB will not create a database in the global cluster you are creating.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateGlobalClusterRequest.DeletionProtection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeletionProtection.
The deletion protection setting for the new global cluster. The global cluster can't be deleted when deletion protection is enabled.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateGlobalClusterRequest.Engine
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Engine.
The name of the database engine to be used for this cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateGlobalClusterRequest.EngineVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngineVersion.
The engine version of the global cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.CreateGlobalClusterRequest.GlobalClusterIdentifier
member.summary:

The cluster identifier of the new global cluster.

member.summary:

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to use as the primary cluster of the global cluster. This parameter is optional.

The storage encryption setting for the new global cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBCluster.PreferredMaintenanceWindow
member.summary:

Specifies the weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBCluster.ReaderEndpoint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReaderEndpoint.
The reader endpoint for the cluster. The reader endpoint for a cluster load balances connections across the Amazon DocumentDB replicas that are available in a cluster. As clients request new connections to the reader endpoint, Amazon DocumentDB distributes the connection requests among the Amazon DocumentDB replicas in the cluster. This functionality can help balance your read workload across multiple Amazon DocumentDB replicas in your cluster.
If a failover occurs, and the Amazon DocumentDB replica that you are connected to is promoted to be the primary instance, your connection is dropped. To continue sending your read workload to other Amazon DocumentDB replicas in the cluster, you can then reconnect to the reader endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBCluster.ReadReplicaIdentifiers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReadReplicaIdentifiers.
Contains one or more identifiers of the secondary clusters that are associated with this cluster.

member.summary:

Contains the identifier of the source cluster if this cluster is a secondary cluster.

member.summary:

Specifies the current state of this cluster.

member.summary:

Specifies whether the cluster is encrypted.

Provides a list of virtual private cloud (VPC) security groups that the cluster belongs to.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterRole.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAMrole that is associated with the DB cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterRole.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Describes the state of association between the IAMrole and the cluster. The Status property returns one of the following values:
ACTIVE - The IAMrole ARN is associated with the cluster and can be used to access other Amazon Web Services services on your behalf.
PENDING - The IAMrole ARN is being associated with the cluster.
INVALID - The IAMrole ARN is associated with the cluster, but the cluster cannot assume the IAMrole to access other Amazon Web Services services on your behalf.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.DBClusterSnapshotArn

Gets and sets the property DBClusterSnapshotArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cluster snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier.
Specifies the identifier for the cluster snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.Engine
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Engine.
Specifies the name of the database engine.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.EngineVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngineVersion.
Provides the version of the database engine for this cluster snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
If StorageEncrypted is true, the KMS key identifier for the encrypted cluster snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.MasterUsername
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MasterUsername.
Provides the master user name for the cluster snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.PercentProgress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PercentProgress.
Specifies the percentage of the estimated data that has been transferred.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
Specifies the port that the cluster was listening on at the time of the snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.SnapshotCreateTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotCreateTime.
Provides the time when the snapshot was taken, in UTC.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.SnapshotType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotType.
Provides the type of the cluster snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.SourceDBClusterSnapshotArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceDBClusterSnapshotArn.
If the cluster snapshot was copied from a source cluster snapshot, the ARN for the source cluster snapshot; otherwise, a null value.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Specifies the status of this cluster snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.StorageEncrypted
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageEncrypted.
Specifies whether the cluster snapshot is encrypted.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshot.VpcId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcId.
Provides the virtual private cloud (VPC) ID that is associated with the cluster snapshot.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshotAttribute
member.summary:
Contains the name and values of a manual cluster snapshot attribute.
Manual cluster snapshot attributes are used to authorize other accounts to restore a manual cluster snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshotAttribute.AttributeName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeName.
The name of the manual cluster snapshot attribute.
The attribute named restore refers to the list of accounts that have permission to copy or restore the manual cluster snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshotAttribute.AttributeValues
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeValues.
The values for the manual cluster snapshot attribute.
If the AttributeName field is set to restore, then this element returns a list of IDs of the accounts that are authorized to copy or restore the manual cluster snapshot. If a value of all is in the list, then the manual cluster snapshot is public and available for any account to copy or restore.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshotAttributesResult
member.summary: Detailed information about the attributes that are associated with a cluster snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshotAttributesResult.DBClusterSnapshotAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterSnapshotAttributes.
The list of attributes and values for the cluster snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBClusterSnapshotAttributesResult.DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier.
The identifier of the cluster snapshot that the attributes apply to.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance
member.summary: Detailed information about an instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.
Does not apply. This parameter does not apply to Amazon DocumentDB. Amazon DocumentDB does not perform minor version upgrades regardless of the value set.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.AvailabilityZone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZone.
Specifies the name of the Availability Zone that the instance is located in.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.BackupRetentionPeriod
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupRetentionPeriod.
Specifies the number of days for which automatic snapshots are retained.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.CACertificateIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CACertificateIdentifier.
The identifier of the CA certificate for this DB instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.DBClusterIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterIdentifier.
Contains the name of the cluster that the instance is a member of if the instance is a member of a cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.DBInstanceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBInstanceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.DBInstanceClass
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBInstanceClass.
Contains the name of the compute and memory capacity class of the instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.DBInstanceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBInstanceIdentifier.
Contains a user-provided database identifier. This identifier is the unique key that identifies an instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.DBInstanceStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBInstanceStatus.
Specifies the current state of this database.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.DbiResourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DbiResourceId.
The Region-unique, immutable identifier for the instance. This identifier is found in CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for the instance is accessed.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.DBSubnetGroup
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBSubnetGroup.
Specifies information on the subnet group that is associated with the instance, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet group.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.EnabledCloudwatchLogsExports
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnabledCloudwatchLogsExports.
A list of log types that this instance is configured to export to CloudWatch Logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.Endpoint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Endpoint.
Specifies the connection endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.Engine
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Engine.
Provides the name of the database engine to be used for this instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.EngineVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngineVersion.
Indicates the database engine version.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.InstanceCreateTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceCreateTime.
Provides the date and time that the instance was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
If StorageEncrypted is true, the KMS key identifier for the encrypted instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.LatestRestorableTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LatestRestorableTime.
Specifies the latest time to which a database can be restored with point-in-time restore.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.PendingModifiedValues
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PendingModifiedValues.
Specifies that changes to the instance are pending. This element is included only when changes are pending. Specific changes are identified by subelements.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.PreferredBackupWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreferredBackupWindow.
Specifies the daily time range during which automated backups are created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the BackupRetentionPeriod.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.PreferredMaintenanceWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreferredMaintenanceWindow.
Specifies the weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.PromotionTier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PromotionTier.
A value that specifies the order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing primary instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.PubliclyAccessible
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PubliclyAccessible.
Not supported. Amazon DocumentDB does not currently support public endpoints. The value of PubliclyAccessible is always false.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.StatusInfos
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusInfos.
The status of a read replica. If the instance is not a read replica, this is blank.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.StorageEncrypted
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageEncrypted.
Specifies whether or not the instance is encrypted.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DBInstance.VpcSecurityGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcSecurityGroups.
Provides a list of VPC security group elements that the instance belongs to.

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterParameterGroupRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteDBClusterParameterGroup operation. Deletes a specified cluster parameter group. The cluster parameter group to be deleted can't be associated with any clusters.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterParameterGroupRequest.DBClusterParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterParameterGroupName.
The name of the cluster parameter group.
Constraints:
Must be the name of an existing cluster parameter group.
You can't delete a default cluster parameter group.
Cannot be associated with any clusters.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterParameterGroupResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteDBClusterParameterGroup operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteDBCluster operation. Deletes a previously provisioned cluster. When you delete a cluster, all automated backups for that cluster are deleted and can't be recovered. Manual DB cluster snapshots of the specified cluster are not deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterRequest.DBClusterIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterIdentifier.
The cluster identifier for the cluster to be deleted. This parameter isn't case sensitive.
Constraints:
Must match an existing DBClusterIdentifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterRequest.FinalDBSnapshotIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FinalDBSnapshotIdentifier.
The cluster snapshot identifier of the new cluster snapshot created when SkipFinalSnapshot is set to false.
Specifying this parameter and also setting the SkipFinalShapshot parameter to true results in an error.
Constraints:
Must be from 1 to 255 letters, numbers, or hyphens.
The first character must be a letter.
Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterRequest.SkipFinalSnapshot
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SkipFinalSnapshot.
Determines whether a final cluster snapshot is created before the cluster is deleted. If true is specified, no cluster snapshot is created. If false is specified, a cluster snapshot is created before the DB cluster is deleted.
If SkipFinalSnapshot is false, you must specify a FinalDBSnapshotIdentifier parameter.
Default: false

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteDBCluster operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterResponse.DBCluster
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DBCluster.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterSnapshotRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteDBClusterSnapshot operation. Deletes a cluster snapshot. If the snapshot is being copied, the copy operation is terminated.
The cluster snapshot must be in the available state to be deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterSnapshotRequest.DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier.
The identifier of the cluster snapshot to delete.
Constraints: Must be the name of an existing cluster snapshot in the available state.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterSnapshotResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteDBClusterSnapshot operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBClusterSnapshotResponse.DBClusterSnapshot
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DBClusterSnapshot.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBInstanceRequest

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBInstanceRequest.DBInstanceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBInstanceIdentifier.
The instance identifier for the instance to be deleted. This parameter isn't case sensitive.
Constraints:
Must match the name of an existing instance.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBInstanceResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBInstanceResponse.DBInstance

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBSubnetGroupRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteDBSubnetGroup operation. Deletes a subnet group.
The specified database subnet group must not be associated with any DB instances.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DeleteDBSubnetGroupRequest.DBSubnetGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBSubnetGroupName.
The name of the database subnet group to delete.
You can't delete the default subnet group.
Constraints:
Must match the name of an existing DBSubnetGroup. Must not be default.
Example: mySubnetgroup

member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteDBSubnetGroup operation.

Container for the parameters to the DeleteGlobalCluster operation. Deletes a global cluster. The primary and secondary clusters must already be detached or deleted before attempting to delete a global cluster.
This action only applies to Amazon DocumentDB clusters.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeCertificatesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeCertificates operation. Returns a list of certificate authority (CA) certificates provided by Amazon DocumentDB for this account.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeCertificatesRequest.CertificateIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CertificateIdentifier.
The user-supplied certificate identifier. If this parameter is specified, information for only the specified certificate is returned. If this parameter is omitted, a list of up to MaxRecords certificates is returned. This parameter is not case sensitive.
Constraints
Must match an existing CertificateIdentifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeCertificatesRequest.Filters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filters.
This parameter is not currently supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeCertificatesRequest.Marker
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Marker.
An optional pagination token provided by a previous DescribeCertificates request. If this parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value specified by MaxRecords.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeCertificatesRequest.MaxRecords
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxRecords.
The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more records exist than the specified MaxRecords value, a pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.
Default: 100
Constraints:
Minimum: 20
Maximum: 100

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeCertificatesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeCertificates operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeCertificatesResponse.Certificates
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Certificates.
A list of certificates for this account.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeCertificatesResponse.Marker
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Marker.
An optional pagination token provided if the number of records retrieved is greater than MaxRecords. If this parameter is specified, the marker specifies the next record in the list. Including the value of Marker in the next call to DescribeCertificates results in the next page of certificates.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeDBClusterParameterGroupsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeDBClusterParameterGroups operation. Returns a list of DBClusterParameterGroup descriptions. If a DBClusterParameterGroupName parameter is specified, the list contains only the description of the specified cluster parameter group.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeDBClusterParameterGroupsRequest.DBClusterParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterParameterGroupName.
The name of a specific cluster parameter group to return details for.
Constraints:
If provided, must match the name of an existing DBClusterParameterGroup.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeDBClusterParameterGroupsRequest.Filters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filters.
This parameter is not currently supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeDBClusterParameterGroupsRequest.Marker
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Marker.
An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value specified by MaxRecords.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeDBClusterParameterGroupsRequest.MaxRecords
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxRecords.
The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more records exist than the specified MaxRecords value, a pagination token (marker) is included in the response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.
Default: 100
Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeDBClusterParameterGroupsResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeDBClusterParameterGroupsResponse.DBClusterParameterGroups
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeDBClusterParameterGroupsResponse.Marker
member.summary:

An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value specified by MaxRecords.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeDBClusterParametersRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeDBClusterParameters operation. Returns the detailed parameter list for a particular cluster parameter group.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeDBClusterParametersRequest.DBClusterParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterParameterGroupName.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeDBClusterSnapshotAttributesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeDBClusterSnapshotAttributes operation. Returns a list of cluster snapshot attribute names and values for a manual DB cluster snapshot.
When you share snapshots with other accounts, DescribeDBClusterSnapshotAttributes returns the restore attribute and a list of IDs for the accounts that are authorized to copy or restore the manual cluster snapshot. If all is included in the list of values for the restore attribute, then the manual cluster snapshot is public and can be copied or restored by all accounts.

member.summary:

Constraints:

member.summary:

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IncludeShared.
Set to true to include shared manual cluster snapshots from other accounts that this account has been given permission to copy or restore, and otherwise false. The default is false.

Default: 100
Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribeDBClusterSnapshotsRequest.SnapshotType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotType.
The type of cluster snapshots to be returned. You can specify one of the following values:
automated - Return all cluster snapshots that Amazon DocumentDB has automatically created for your account.
manual - Return all cluster snapshots that you have manually created for your account.
shared - Return all manual cluster snapshots that have been shared to your account.
public - Return all cluster snapshots that have been marked as public.
If you don't specify a SnapshotType value, then both automated and manual cluster snapshots are returned. You can include shared cluster snapshots with these results by setting the IncludeShared parameter to true. You can include public cluster snapshots with these results by setting theIncludePublic parameter to true.
The IncludeShared and IncludePublic parameters don't apply for SnapshotType values of manual or automated. The IncludePublic parameter doesn't apply when SnapshotType is set to shared. The IncludeShared parameter doesn't apply when SnapshotType is set to public.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribePendingMaintenanceActionsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribePendingMaintenanceActions operation. Returns a list of resources (for example, instances) that have at least one pending maintenance action.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribePendingMaintenanceActionsRequest.Filters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filters.
A filter that specifies one or more resources to return pending maintenance actions for.
Supported filters:
db-cluster-id - Accepts cluster identifiers and cluster Amazon Resource Names (ARNs). The results list includes only pending maintenance actions for the clusters identified by these ARNs.
db-instance-id - Accepts instance identifiers and instance ARNs. The results list includes only pending maintenance actions for the DB instances identified by these ARNs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribePendingMaintenanceActionsRequest.Marker
member.summary:

An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value specified by MaxRecords.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribePendingMaintenanceActionsRequest.MaxRecords
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxRecords.
The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more records exist than the specified MaxRecords value, a pagination token (marker) is included in the response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.
Default: 100
Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.DescribePendingMaintenanceActionsRequest.ResourceIdentifier
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.FailoverDBClusterRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the FailoverDBCluster operation. Forces a failover for a cluster.
A failover for a cluster promotes one of the Amazon DocumentDB replicas (read-only instances) in the cluster to be the primary instance (the cluster writer).
If the primary instance fails, Amazon DocumentDB automatically fails over to an Amazon DocumentDB replica, if one exists. You can force a failover when you want to simulate a failure of a primary instance for testing.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.FailoverDBClusterRequest.DBClusterIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterIdentifier.
A cluster identifier to force a failover for. This parameter is not case sensitive.
Constraints:
Must match the identifier of an existing DBCluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.FailoverDBClusterRequest.TargetDBInstanceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetDBInstanceIdentifier.
The name of the instance to promote to the primary instance.
You must specify the instance identifier for an Amazon DocumentDB replica in the cluster. For example, mydbcluster-replica1.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.FailoverDBClusterResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the FailoverDBCluster operation.

Wildcards are not supported in filters.

member.summary:

The name of the filter. Filter names are case sensitive.

One or more filter values. Filter values are case sensitive.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterParameterGroupRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ModifyDBClusterParameterGroup operation. Modifies the parameters of a cluster parameter group. To modify more than one parameter, submit a list of the following: ParameterName, ParameterValue, and ApplyMethod. A maximum of 20 parameters can be modified in a single request.
Changes to dynamic parameters are applied immediately. Changes to static parameters require a reboot or maintenance window before the change can take effect.
After you create a cluster parameter group, you should wait at least 5 minutes before creating your first cluster that uses that cluster parameter group as the default parameter group. This allows Amazon DocumentDB to fully complete the create action before the parameter group is used as the default for a new cluster. This step is especially important for parameters that are critical when creating the default database for a cluster, such as the character set for the default database defined by the character_set_database parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterParameterGroupRequest.DBClusterParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterParameterGroupName.
The name of the cluster parameter group to modify.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterParameterGroupRequest.Parameters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Parameters.
A list of parameters in the cluster parameter group to modify.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterParameterGroupResponse
member.summary: Contains the name of a cluster parameter group.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterParameterGroupResponse.DBClusterParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterParameterGroupName.
The name of a cluster parameter group.
Constraints:
Must be from 1 to 255 letters or numbers.
The first character must be a letter.
Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
This value is stored as a lowercase string.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ModifyDBCluster operation. Modifies a setting for an Amazon DocumentDB cluster. You can change one or more database configuration parameters by specifying these parameters and the new values in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.ApplyImmediately
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ApplyImmediately.
A value that specifies whether the changes in this request and any pending changes are asynchronously applied as soon as possible, regardless of the PreferredMaintenanceWindow setting for the cluster. If this parameter is set to false, changes to the cluster are applied during the next maintenance window.
The ApplyImmediately parameter affects only the NewDBClusterIdentifier and MasterUserPassword values. If you set this parameter value to false, the changes to the NewDBClusterIdentifier and MasterUserPassword values are applied during the next maintenance window. All other changes are applied immediately, regardless of the value of the ApplyImmediately parameter.
Default: false

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.BackupRetentionPeriod
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupRetentionPeriod.
The number of days for which automated backups are retained. You must specify a minimum value of 1.
Default: 1
Constraints:
Must be a value from 1 to 35.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration.
The configuration setting for the log types to be enabled for export to Amazon CloudWatch Logs for a specific instance or cluster. The EnableLogTypes and DisableLogTypes arrays determine which logs are exported (or not exported) to CloudWatch Logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.DBClusterIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterIdentifier.
The cluster identifier for the cluster that is being modified. This parameter is not case sensitive.
Constraints:
Must match the identifier of an existing DBCluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.DBClusterParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterParameterGroupName.
The name of the cluster parameter group to use for the cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.DeletionProtection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeletionProtection.
Specifies whether this cluster can be deleted. If DeletionProtection is enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted unless it is modified and DeletionProtection is disabled. DeletionProtection protects clusters from being accidentally deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.EngineVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngineVersion.
The version number of the database engine to which you want to upgrade. Modifying engine version is not supported on Amazon DocumentDB.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.MasterUserPassword
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MasterUserPassword.
The password for the master database user. This password can contain any printable ASCII character except forward slash (/), double quote ("), or the "at" symbol (@).
Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 100 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.NewDBClusterIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NewDBClusterIdentifier.
The new cluster identifier for the cluster when renaming a cluster. This value is stored as a lowercase string.
Constraints:
Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.
The first character must be a letter.
Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
Example: my-cluster2

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
The port number on which the cluster accepts connections.
Constraints: Must be a value from 1150 to 65535.
Default: The same port as the original cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.PreferredBackupWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreferredBackupWindow.
The daily time range during which automated backups are created if automated backups are enabled, using the BackupRetentionPeriod parameter.
The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour block of time for each Region.
Constraints:
Must be in the format hh24:mi-hh24:mi.
Must be in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
Must not conflict with the preferred maintenance window.
Must be at least 30 minutes.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.PreferredMaintenanceWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreferredMaintenanceWindow.
The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi
The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour block of time for each Region, occurring on a random day of the week.
Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
Constraints: Minimum 30-minute window.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterRequest.VpcSecurityGroupIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcSecurityGroupIds.
A list of virtual private cloud (VPC) security groups that the cluster will belong to.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ModifyDBCluster operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterResponse.DBCluster
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DBCluster.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute operation. Adds an attribute and values to, or removes an attribute and values from, a manual cluster snapshot.
To share a manual cluster snapshot with other accounts, specify restore as the AttributeName, and use the ValuesToAdd parameter to add a list of IDs of the accounts that are authorized to restore the manual cluster snapshot. Use the value all to make the manual cluster snapshot public, which means that it can be copied or restored by all accounts. Do not add the all value for any manual cluster snapshots that contain private information that you don't want available to all accounts. If a manual cluster snapshot is encrypted, it can be shared, but only by specifying a list of authorized account IDs for the ValuesToAdd parameter. You can't use all as a value for that parameter in this case.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeRequest.AttributeName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeName.
The name of the cluster snapshot attribute to modify.
To manage authorization for other accounts to copy or restore a manual cluster snapshot, set this value to restore.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeRequest.DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier.
The identifier for the cluster snapshot to modify the attributes for.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeRequest.ValuesToAdd
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ValuesToAdd.
A list of cluster snapshot attributes to add to the attribute specified by AttributeName.
To authorize other accounts to copy or restore a manual cluster snapshot, set this list to include one or more account IDs. To make the manual cluster snapshot restorable by any account, set it to all. Do not add the all value for any manual cluster snapshots that contain private information that you don't want to be available to all accounts.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeRequest.ValuesToRemove
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ValuesToRemove.
A list of cluster snapshot attributes to remove from the attribute specified by AttributeName.
To remove authorization for other accounts to copy or restore a manual cluster snapshot, set this list to include one or more account identifiers. To remove authorization for any account to copy or restore the cluster snapshot, set it to all . If you specify all, an account whose account ID is explicitly added to the restore attribute can still copy or restore a manual cluster snapshot.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeResponse.DBClusterSnapshotAttributesResult
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DBClusterSnapshotAttributesResult.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBInstanceRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ModifyDBInstance operation. Modifies settings for an instance. You can change one or more database configuration parameters by specifying these parameters and the new values in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBInstanceRequest.ApplyImmediately
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ApplyImmediately.
Specifies whether the modifications in this request and any pending modifications are asynchronously applied as soon as possible, regardless of the PreferredMaintenanceWindow setting for the instance.
If this parameter is set to false, changes to the instance are applied during the next maintenance window. Some parameter changes can cause an outage and are applied on the next reboot.
Default: false

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBInstanceRequest.AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.
This parameter does not apply to Amazon DocumentDB. Amazon DocumentDB does not perform minor version upgrades regardless of the value set.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBInstanceRequest.CACertificateIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CACertificateIdentifier.
Indicates the certificate that needs to be associated with the instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBInstanceRequest.DBInstanceClass
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBInstanceClass.
The new compute and memory capacity of the instance; for example, db.r5.large. Not all instance classes are available in all Regions.
If you modify the instance class, an outage occurs during the change. The change is applied during the next maintenance window, unless ApplyImmediately is specified as true for this request.
Default: Uses existing setting.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBInstanceRequest.DBInstanceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBInstanceIdentifier.
The instance identifier. This value is stored as a lowercase string.
Constraints:
Must match the identifier of an existing DBInstance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBInstanceRequest.NewDBInstanceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NewDBInstanceIdentifier.
The new instance identifier for the instance when renaming an instance. When you change the instance identifier, an instance reboot occurs immediately if you set Apply Immediately to true. It occurs during the next maintenance window if you set Apply Immediately to false. This value is stored as a lowercase string.
Constraints:
Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.
The first character must be a letter.
Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
Example: mydbinstance

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBInstanceRequest.PreferredMaintenanceWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreferredMaintenanceWindow.
The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can occur, which might result in an outage. Changing this parameter doesn't result in an outage except in the following situation, and the change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible. If there are pending actions that cause a reboot, and the maintenance window is changed to include the current time, changing this parameter causes a reboot of the instance. If you are moving this window to the current time, there must be at least 30 minutes between the current time and end of the window to ensure that pending changes are applied.
Default: Uses existing setting.
Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi
Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBInstanceRequest.PromotionTier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PromotionTier.
A value that specifies the order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing primary instance.
Default: 1
Valid values: 0-15

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBInstanceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ModifyDBInstance operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBInstanceResponse.DBInstance
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DBInstance.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBSubnetGroupRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ModifyDBSubnetGroup operation. Modifies an existing subnet group. subnet groups must contain at least one subnet in at least two Availability Zones in the Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ModifyDBSubnetGroupRequest.DBSubnetGroupDescription
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RebootDBInstanceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the RebootDBInstance operation. You might need to reboot your instance, usually for maintenance reasons. For example, if you make certain changes, or if you change the cluster parameter group that is associated with the instance, you must reboot the instance for the changes to take effect.
Rebooting an instance restarts the database engine service. Rebooting an instance results in a momentary outage, during which the instance status is set to rebooting.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RebootDBInstanceRequest.DBInstanceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBInstanceIdentifier.
The instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
Constraints:
Must match the identifier of an existing DBInstance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RebootDBInstanceRequest.ForceFailover
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ForceFailover.
When true, the reboot is conducted through a Multi-AZ failover.
Constraint: You can't specify true if the instance is not configured for Multi-AZ.

member.summary: This is the response object from the RebootDBInstance operation.

Container for the parameters to the RemoveFromGlobalCluster operation. Detaches an Amazon DocumentDB secondary cluster from a global cluster. The cluster becomes a standalone cluster with read-write capability instead of being read-only and receiving data from a primary in a different region.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ResetDBClusterParameterGroupRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ResetDBClusterParameterGroup operation. Modifies the parameters of a cluster parameter group to the default value. To reset specific parameters, submit a list of the following: ParameterName and ApplyMethod. To reset the entire cluster parameter group, specify the DBClusterParameterGroupName and ResetAllParameters parameters.
When you reset the entire group, dynamic parameters are updated immediately and static parameters are set to pending-reboot to take effect on the next DB instance reboot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ResetDBClusterParameterGroupRequest.DBClusterParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterParameterGroupName.
The name of the cluster parameter group to reset.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ResetDBClusterParameterGroupRequest.Parameters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Parameters.
A list of parameter names in the cluster parameter group to reset to the default values. You can't use this parameter if the ResetAllParameters parameter is set to true.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ResetDBClusterParameterGroupRequest.ResetAllParameters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResetAllParameters.
A value that is set to true to reset all parameters in the cluster parameter group to their default values, and false otherwise. You can't use this parameter if there is a list of parameter names specified for the Parameters parameter.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ResetDBClusterParameterGroupResponse
member.summary: Contains the name of a cluster parameter group.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.ResetDBClusterParameterGroupResponse.DBClusterParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterParameterGroupName.
The name of a cluster parameter group.
Constraints:
Must be from 1 to 255 letters or numbers.
The first character must be a letter.
Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
This value is stored as a lowercase string.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot operation. Creates a new cluster from a snapshot or cluster snapshot.
If a snapshot is specified, the target cluster is created from the source DB snapshot with a default configuration and default security group.
If a cluster snapshot is specified, the target cluster is created from the source cluster restore point with the same configuration as the original source DB cluster, except that the new cluster is created with the default security group.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest.AvailabilityZones
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZones.
Provides the list of Amazon EC2 Availability Zones that instances in the restored DB cluster can be created in.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest.DBClusterIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterIdentifier.
The name of the cluster to create from the snapshot or cluster snapshot. This parameter isn't case sensitive.
Constraints:
Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.
The first character must be a letter.
Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
Example: my-snapshot-id

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest.DBSubnetGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBSubnetGroupName.
The name of the subnet group to use for the new cluster.
Constraints: If provided, must match the name of an existing DBSubnetGroup.
Example: mySubnetgroup

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest.DeletionProtection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeletionProtection.
Specifies whether this cluster can be deleted. If DeletionProtection is enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted unless it is modified and DeletionProtection is disabled. DeletionProtection protects clusters from being accidentally deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest.EnableCloudwatchLogsExports
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnableCloudwatchLogsExports.
A list of log types that must be enabled for exporting to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest.Engine
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Engine.
The database engine to use for the new cluster.
Default: The same as source.
Constraint: Must be compatible with the engine of the source.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest.EngineVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngineVersion.
The version of the database engine to use for the new cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
The KMS key identifier to use when restoring an encrypted cluster from a DB snapshot or cluster snapshot.
The KMS key identifier is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the KMS encryption key. If you are restoring a cluster with the same account that owns the KMS encryption key used to encrypt the new cluster, then you can use the KMS key alias instead of the ARN for the KMS encryption key.
If you do not specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then the following occurs:
If the snapshot or cluster snapshot in SnapshotIdentifier is encrypted, then the restored cluster is encrypted using the KMS key that was used to encrypt the snapshot or the cluster snapshot.
If the snapshot or the cluster snapshot in SnapshotIdentifier is not encrypted, then the restored DB cluster is not encrypted.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
The port number on which the new cluster accepts connections.
Constraints: Must be a value from 1150 to 65535.
Default: The same port as the original cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest.SnapshotIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotIdentifier.
The identifier for the snapshot or cluster snapshot to restore from.
You can use either the name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to specify a cluster snapshot. However, you can use only the ARN to specify a snapshot.
Constraints:
Must match the identifier of an existing snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags to be assigned to the restored cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotRequest.VpcSecurityGroupIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcSecurityGroupIds.
A list of virtual private cloud (VPC) security groups that the new cluster will belong to.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshotResponse.DBCluster
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DBCluster.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterToPointInTimeRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime operation. Restores a cluster to an arbitrary point in time. Users can restore to any point in time before LatestRestorableTime for up to BackupRetentionPeriod days. The target cluster is created from the source cluster with the same configuration as the original cluster, except that the new cluster is created with the default security group.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterToPointInTimeRequest.DBClusterIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBClusterIdentifier.
The name of the new cluster to be created.
Constraints:
Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.
The first character must be a letter.
Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterToPointInTimeRequest.DBSubnetGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DBSubnetGroupName.
The subnet group name to use for the new cluster.
Constraints: If provided, must match the name of an existing DBSubnetGroup.
Example: mySubnetgroup

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterToPointInTimeRequest.DeletionProtection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeletionProtection.
Specifies whether this cluster can be deleted. If DeletionProtection is enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted unless it is modified and DeletionProtection is disabled. DeletionProtection protects clusters from being accidentally deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterToPointInTimeRequest.EnableCloudwatchLogsExports
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnableCloudwatchLogsExports.
A list of log types that must be enabled for exporting to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterToPointInTimeRequest.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
The KMS key identifier to use when restoring an encrypted cluster from an encrypted cluster.
The KMS key identifier is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the KMS encryption key. If you are restoring a cluster with the same account that owns the KMS encryption key used to encrypt the new cluster, then you can use the KMS key alias instead of the ARN for the KMS encryption key.
You can restore to a new cluster and encrypt the new cluster with an KMS key that is different from the KMS key used to encrypt the source cluster. The new DB cluster is encrypted with the KMS key identified by the KmsKeyId parameter.
If you do not specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then the following occurs:
If the cluster is encrypted, then the restored cluster is encrypted using the KMS key that was used to encrypt the source cluster.
If the cluster is not encrypted, then the restored cluster is not encrypted.
If DBClusterIdentifier refers to a cluster that is not encrypted, then the restore request is rejected.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterToPointInTimeRequest.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
The port number on which the new cluster accepts connections.
Constraints: Must be a value from 1150 to 65535.
Default: The default port for the engine.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterToPointInTimeRequest.RestoreToTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreToTime.
The date and time to restore the cluster to.
Valid values: A time in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) format.
Constraints:
Must be before the latest restorable time for the instance.
Must be specified if the UseLatestRestorableTime parameter is not provided.
Cannot be specified if the UseLatestRestorableTime parameter is true.
Cannot be specified if the RestoreType parameter is copy-on-write.
Example: 2015-03-07T23:45:00Z

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterToPointInTimeRequest.SourceDBClusterIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceDBClusterIdentifier.
The identifier of the source cluster from which to restore.
Constraints:
Must match the identifier of an existing DBCluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterToPointInTimeRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags to be assigned to the restored cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterToPointInTimeRequest.UseLatestRestorableTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseLatestRestorableTime.
A value that is set to true to restore the cluster to the latest restorable backup time, and false otherwise.
Default: false
Constraints: Cannot be specified if the RestoreToTime parameter is provided.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.RestoreDBClusterToPointInTimeRequest.VpcSecurityGroupIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcSecurityGroupIds.
A list of VPC security groups that the new cluster belongs to.

member.name: T:Amazon.DocDB.Model.Tag
member.summary: Metadata assigned to an Amazon DocumentDB resource consisting of a key-value pair.

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.Tag.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
The required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or "rds:". The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").

member.name: P:Amazon.DocDB.Model.Tag.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
The optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or "rds:". The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").

member.name: M:Amazon.DocDB.AmazonDocDBClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonDocDBClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
